intro: Gyrocarpus americanus subsp. pinnatilobus, commonly known as the tropical nut tree, is a member of the family Sapotaceae. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing a single, hard-shelled seed, which is often used as a nut. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
